page.title: 14THE BURTON PIDSEA CARNIVAL
page.content: The Carnival began as an Annual Garden Party at Chatt House. As the village got bigger they couldn't fit everyone in so in 1982 they thought of changing to a Carnival. Preparations for the Carnival begin in November of the previous year.They do not always have the same events and attractions. And things sometimes go wrong - like the year when the hounds got into the cake tent and ate all the cakes. Sometimes attractions don't turn up at all. Last year there was meant to be a Donkey Derby but the donkeys didn't arrive. Between 2000 and 2500 people are expected to attend the Carnival, which raises around Â£7000 for the Memorial Hall Funds. The parade of floats sets off at 1 p.m. The Carnival opens at 1.30 p.m. and finishes when you have had enough.
